results.title: India
results.creator_credit: Colin Baker, Australia. Special Broadcasting Service and Cinegroup
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “A Travellers’ guide to the Orient”.
India is a land of contrasts: imperial grandeur sits next to miserable poverty; the steep icy pinnacles of the Himalayas and the corrosive heat of Calcutta. This video begins by taking us through the frenzied streets of Calcutta, then we go onto Darjeeling and witness a sunrise over the Himalayas. The other places spotlighted on this beautifully shot video include Orissa, Puri, Madras, Konark, Hyderabad, Bangalore and we visit the majestic palaces of the Maharajahs in Mysore. The journey ends amongst the spiritual havens of Ooty and Cochin.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Colin Baker, Australia. Special Broadcasting Service and Cinegroup

results.title: Index to progress
results.creator_credit: Walter F. Broome and Beechdale Educational Films
results.brief_description: A survey of urban and rural library services in Great Britain. Shows the following various types of libraries and the services provided by each: Reference, Commercial, Technical and Children’s libraries and the local collection.

results.title: Independent Nigeria
results.creator_credit: George Sturt, Beric Knight-Simpson, Nigeria. Federal Information Unit and Federal Film Unit
results.brief_description: Nigeria on the eve of independence. Gives a general picture of the country, showing its progress in economic, political and social spheres. Recent developments in agriculture and industry; medical education and social services; housing and transport, are illustrated. Describes the different races, religions and customs of the people of Nigeria, and includes colourful scenes of traditional pageantry.

results.title: Independent living centre [Turkish Version]
results.brief_description: Outlines the highly specialised and unique services of the Independent Living Centre in Victoria which aims to assist people with disabilities to enhance their independence and quality of life by providing demonstrations, advice and information on a comprehensive range of aids and equipment for daily living. Narrated in Turkish.

results.title: Independent company
results.creator_credit: John Tatoulis, Colin South and Media World
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Warriors”.
The story of Sparrow Force, the Australian 2/2 Independent Company, a specially trained troop of Australian soldiers sent to join Dutch forces in Timor in 1941, to defend Northern Australia against the Japanese advance. The program uses interviews with surviving Company members, as well as their Japanese opponents, mixed with re-enactments of their experiences. The interviews reveal that without the selfless assistance of the Timorese, the Australian troops would not have survived. The program also features footage shot by Academy Award winning Australian news cameraman, Damien Parer, who was killed in action in New Guinea.
results.creator_credit_for_label: John Tatoulis, Colin South and Media World

results.title: Independence Day USA
results.creator_credit: John G. Fuller and United States Information Agency
results.brief_description: Describes the various ways in which individual Americans celebrate their Independence Day, July 4th. They honour the heroes responsible for the Declaration of Independence and the national ideals of human rights embodied in it.
